column1: Jahangirabad is a town in Bulandshahr district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. The town is named after emperor Jahangir
column2: who is said to have stayed here for a couple of days. It has various holy places like Binner Devi
column4: Peetambra Devi. People celebrate festivals like Holi
column6: Krishna Janmashtmi etc. There is a beautiful Jahangirabad Fort built right in the center of the town. Next Generations of Kunwar Tara Singh
column7: Rajput families currently reside in the fort.

column1: Jahangirabad was founded at the same time as Anupshahr by the same Bargujar Raja Ani Rai
column2: who saved Emperor Jahangir’s life when he was attacked by the tiger he went out for tiger- hunting expedition. For displaying such a courage
column3: Raja was rewarded with a grant of 84 villages in Jagir
column4: lying on either side of the Ganges
column5: and the title of Raja Ani Rai Sinha Dalan.

column1: Raja Ani Rai named the town after the Emperor and Jahangirabad was as a matter of fact
column3: the Raja moving its headquarters to Anupshahr at a later date. It has two government school and a government hospital. Mostly people of Jahangirabad is engaged in their shops business as it has a huge 2km long market. The nearby college to Jahangirabad is RDPD GIRLS PG College and RDPD Institute of higher education. Jahangirabad has the second largest naveen mandi of rice and wheat of Uttar Pradesh.

column1: Jahangirabad is located on Bulandshahr - Anoopshahr Road. It is 100 KM far from IGI

column2: Jahangirabad had a population of between 100
column4: 000. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Jahangirabad has an average literacy rate of 51%
column5: lower than the national average of 74.04 (2011): male literacy is 61%
